decks.notes: The main strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells and disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Sink into Stupor. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells like Fatal Push and Subtlety to deal with threats on the board. Additionally, the deck utilizes card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Wan Shi Tong, Librarian to outvalue the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and grind out a win through attrition and resource management.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently reanimating powerful creatures such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Solitude. It has multiple ways to protect its combo pieces with counterspells like Force of Negation and disruption like Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes cards like Psychic Frog and Faithful Mending to draw cards and filter through the deck for its combo pieces. It aims to put pressure on the opponent by quickly assembling its combo and overwhelming them with powerful threats.

Utilize ramp and control elements to quickly play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Devourer of Destiny while disrupting your opponent's game plan with spells like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return. Use cards like Talisman of Impulse and Utopia Sprawl to accelerate your mana production and secure victory with overwhelming Eldrazi threats. Masterfully manage your resources and disrupt your opponent's strategies to dominate the game and overwhelm your opponent with Eldrazi power.

The key concept of this landless Combo deck is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to generate a large amount of mana and cast Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes counterspells, card draw, and mana acceleration to efficiently execute the combo. The inclusion of supplementary disruptive elements like Disrupting Shoal and Suppression Ray helps control the opponent's board and protect the combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to win through a fast and powerful combo while preventing the opponent from disrupting its strategy.

The main idea behind this deck is to ramp up your mana quickly using land bounce effects and extra land drops in order to cast Primeval Titan as early as possible. The deck focuses on assembling the Amulet of Vigor and bouncing lands to generate extra mana and take advantage of powerful land cards like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field. With Primeval Titan, the goal is to search for lands like Gruul Turf and Vesuva to create a strong board presence and potentially combo off with cards like Scapeshift for a game-winning play.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm your opponent. Key cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls provide early pressure, while cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment offer versatile removal and reach. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to help close out games. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and powerful planeswalkers, this deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Phelia with disruption elements like Teferi, Solitude, and Prismatic Ending to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily pushing damage. It also utilizes powerful cards like Phlage and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to close out the game quickly. The deck aims to control the board while applying pressure, using a mix of removal, disruption, and powerful threats to outpace the opponent and secure a victory. By efficiently using its resources and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to overwhelm and outmaneuver its opponents in a proactive manner.

This deck focuses on utilizing cycling creatures like Street Wraith and Striped Riverwinder to fill up your graveyard and then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. Cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety help protect your combo while cards like Ardent Plea and Generous Ent help you cycle through your deck quickly. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves once Living End is cast, while also utilizing disruptive spells like Sink into Stupor and Press the Enemy to control the board.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and utilizing them to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of threats. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga to ramp out threats quickly, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Metallic Rebuke and Engineered Explosives. Emry, Lurker of the Loch provides card advantage and recursion, while Pithing Needle and Tormod's Crypt are included to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace and outpace the opponent with its aggressive artifact-based strategy.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to stall out the game using counter spells and removal until it can establish control with powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Thundertrap Trainer. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Mystic Gate and Snapcaster Mage to outvalue the opponent. With a mix of interactive spells and versatile threats, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly grinding out a win through incremental advantage and powerful finishers.

The deck focuses on generating a high amount of mana quickly through rituals and medallions to cast powerful spells like Grapeshot and Wrenn's Resolve. It uses card draw and impulse effects to find key combo pieces while utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage for additional card advantage and burn potential. The deck also includes land manipulation with cards like Valakut Awakening and Gemstone Caverns to ensure consistent mana production. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to execute a lethal combo and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and damage.

This deck focuses on using efficient creatures with strong aggressive abilities, such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, to quickly overwhelm opponents. It also includes powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial to control the board and protect your creatures. The deck utilizes a diverse mana base with a mix of fetch lands and triomes to ensure consistent access to the colors needed for its diverse array of threats. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact helps provide additional synergy and protection for the deck's creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The key strategy involves using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tormod's Crypt to generate value and disruption, while also utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Mox Opal to ramp up quickly and flood the board with threats. By combining artifact synergy with efficient threats and disruption, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in order to secure a decisive victory.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful spells. The deck focuses on aggression and tempo, utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply early pressure. The deck also incorporates cards like Goblin Bombardment and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury for additional reach and damage potential. Overall, the deck aims to maintain board presence, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out games quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. With a mix of creatures that provide value and removal spells to deal with threats, it aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. By efficiently using its resources and leveraging the synergy between its cards, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure and closing out the game with powerful finishers.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers. It utilizes cards like Terminus and Solitude to control the board, while Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils provide card advantage and disruption. The inclusion of Isochron Scepter with Orim's Chant adds another layer of control. The deck also features some unconventional choices like Meticulous Archive and Monumental Henge for additional card draw and late-game advantages. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and out-value the opponent with its powerful spells and planeswalkers.
